item.title: 波音罢工结束后美国工业生产超出预期
item.description: 美国 12 月份工业生产增幅超过预期，这主要得益于工厂产出回升，表明制造业在经历两年的疲软之后正在企稳。【原文：US industrial production rose in December by more than forecast, helped by a pickup in factory output that indicates manufacturing is stabilizing after two years of weakness.】

item.title: 高盛向所罗门和沃尔德伦颁发 8000 万美元留任奖
item.description: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc）向其两位高管颁发了每人价值 8000 万美元的留任奖，并推出了一项新计划，让其领导层从私募股权基金赚取的结转利息中分一杯羹，试图在薪酬方面与顶级另类资产管理公司展开竞争。【原文：Goldman Sachs Group Inc. handed its top two executives retention awards valued at $80 million each and introduced a new program to give its leaders a slice of carried interest earned on private equity funds as it tries to compete on pay with top alternative asset managers.】

item.title: 莫桑比克反对党首领发出暂停抗议的信号
item.description: 莫桑比克反对党领导人蒙德拉内（Venâncio Mondlane）表示，他对暂停一直冲击着这个东南非国家的抗议活动持开放态度，即使公务员计划举行罢工。【原文：Mozambican opposition leader Venâncio Mondlane said he was open to pausing protests that have been hammering the southeast African nation, even as civil servants plan a pay strike.】

item.title: 特朗普威胁征收关税，欧盟与墨西哥达成贸易协议
item.description: 欧盟和墨西哥同意修订自由贸易协定，而两国都面临着当选总统唐纳德-特朗普的压力，特朗普威胁要对两国征收新一轮关税。【原文：The European Union and Mexico agreed to a revamped free-trade agreement, just as both are under pressure from President-elect Donald Trump, who has threatened them with a new round of tariffs.】

item.title: 意大利银行称 2024 年底经济仍将疲软
item.description: 据意大利中央银行称，今年最后几个月意大利经济增长有限。【原文：Italian economic growth was limited in the final months of the year, according to the country’s central bank.】

item.title: 债券大跌引发美联储减息是否失误的争论
item.description: 两周后，当美联储官员齐聚一堂时，他们可能会思考市场上一个令人费解的趋势：自 9 月份以来，当他们将短期利率下调整整一个百分点时，长期政府债券收益率也出现了大致相同幅度的波动，但方向却恰恰相反。【原文：When Federal Reserve officials gather in two weeks they’re likely to ponder a puzzling trend in markets: Since September, as they lowered short-term interest rates by a full percentage point, longer-term government bond yields moved by a roughly equal amount — but in the opposite direction.】

item.title: 国际货币基金组织（IMF）对里夫斯的预算案给予不温不火的支持，指出英国经济增长势头良好
item.description: 国际货币基金组织（International Monetary Fund）对雷切尔-里夫斯（Rachel Reeves）的大手笔预算只提供了冷淡的支持，将其对今年经济增长的预测仅上调了 0.1 个百分点，使其成为仅次于美国和加拿大的七国集团中增长第三快的经济体。【原文：The International Monetary Fund has offered only luke-warm support for Rachel Reeves’ big-spending budget, upgrading its growth forecast for this year by just 0.1 percentage points and leaving it as the third fastest growing Group of Seven economy behind the US and Canada.】

item.description: LVMH 花了将近一年半的时间才从诺和诺德公司手中夺回欧洲最大股票的宝座。【原文：It’s taken LVMH nearly a year-and-a-half to regain its spot as Europe’s biggest stock from Novo Nordisk A/S.】

item.title: Bumble 创始人惠特尼-沃尔夫-赫德将于 3 月重返公司担任首席执行官
item.description: Bumble Inc. 创始人惠特尼-沃尔夫-赫德（Whitney Wolfe Herd）周五在一份声明中表示，将重返这个约会应用品牌，担任首席执行官。【原文：Bumble Inc. founder Whitney Wolfe Herd will return to the dating-app brand as Chief Executive Officer, the company said in a statement Friday.】

item.title: 麦克尔姆面临特朗普关税，加拿大软着陆岌岌可危
item.description: 加拿大央行行长蒂夫-马克莱姆（Tiff Macklem）成功化解了加拿大央行历史上最严重的通胀危机之一，使加拿大走上了软着陆的轨道。美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普可能会大笔一挥，将这一切推翻。【原文：Governor Tiff Macklem has successfully wrestled down one of the worst inflationary crises in the Bank of Canada’s history, putting his nation on track for a soft landing. US President-elect Donald Trump may dismantle all that with a stroke of a pen.】

item.title: 美国多户住宅建筑开工率高于预期
item.description: 美国 12 月份的房屋开工率攀升至 2024 年初以来的最快速度，反映出多户住宅项目的激增和一户住宅的小幅增长。【原文：Housing starts in the US climbed in December to the fastest pace since early 2024, reflecting a surge in multifamily projects and a more modest advance in one-family homes.】

item.title: 如果特朗普解除冻结，将推进的液化天然气项目如下
item.description: 美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普发誓将在下周上任的第一天取消拜登政府暂停液化天然气出口的禁令。这一承诺的逆转对于美国一些悬而未决的项目来说至关重要。【原文：President-elect Donald Trump has vowed to lift the Biden administration’s moratorium on new permits to export liquefied natural gas on his first day in office next week. The promised reversal is key for a number of US projects hanging in the balance.】

item.title: 土耳其央行就降息路径发出混合信号
item.description: 土耳其央行在上个月做出了近两年来的首次降息，投资者表示，他们从土耳其央行官员那里得到的降息步伐信号不一。【原文：Investors say they are receiving mixed signals from Turkish central bank officials on the pace of interest-rate cuts after the first reduction in almost two years last month.】

item.title: 前财政部长弗里兰加入加拿大领导人竞选
item.description: 加拿大前财政部长克里斯蒂娅-弗里兰（Chrystia Freeland）在 12 月辞职时帮助贾斯汀-特鲁多结束了自己的政治生涯。【原文：Chrystia Freeland, the former Canadian finance minister who helped bring Justin Trudeau’s political career to an end when she resigned in December, has joined the race to replace him as prime minister.】

item.description: 在美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普敦促欧洲盟国增加军费后，立陶宛计划增加国防开支，以遏制来自俄罗斯的潜在威胁。【原文：Lithuania plans to increase defense spending to deter potential threats from Russia after US President-elect Donald Trump urged European allies to boost funds for the military.】

item.title: Zara 中东地区运营商寻求银行为首次公开募股提供支持
item.description: 据熟知内情的人士透露，Zara 服装和 Virgin Megastore 连锁店在中东地区的运营商正在探讨首次公开募股的可能性。【原文：The operator of Zara clothing and Virgin Megastore chains in the Middle East is exploring a possible initial public offering, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 印度将投资 13 亿美元重振濒临破产的钢铁企业
item.description: 印度已批准投资 1,144 亿卢比（13 亿美元）重振国有钢铁企业 Rashtriya Ispat Nigam Ltd.。【原文：India has approved an investment of 114.4 billion rupees ($1.3 billion) to revive state-owned steelmaker Rashtriya Ispat Nigam Ltd. that’s struggling to survive in the face of financial hardships.】

item.title: 尼日利亚州长有条件地支持税收改革
item.description: 尼日利亚有权势的州长们放弃了对国家税收改革的反对，但条件是必须放弃削减公司税和提高增值税的计划。【原文：Nigeria’s powerful state governors dropped their opposition to an overhaul of the nation’s taxes, provided that plans to cut corporate tax and raise value added tax are abandoned.】

item.title: 随着监管机构扩大调查范围，马斯克的 X 汽车又被欧盟要求提供数据
item.description: 欧盟扩大了对埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的 X 公司是否违反欧盟内容审核规则的调查，要求该社交媒体平台交出内部数据。【原文：The European Union has expanded its investigation into whether Elon Musk’s X is in breach of the bloc’s content moderation rulebook by demanding the social media platform hand over internal data.】

item.title: 诺贝尔奖获得者要求 "登月 "科技努力消除饥饿危机
item.description: 150 多位诺贝尔奖和世界粮食奖获得者表示，与约翰-肯尼迪总统在 20 世纪 60 年代提出的将人类送上月球的倡议一样，另一项巨大的努力也亟需帮助：战胜饥饿。【原文：Echoing President John F. Kennedy’s initiative to put man on the moon in the 1960s, more than 150 Nobel and World Food Prize laureates say urgent help is needed for another mammoth effort: Fighting hunger.】

item.title: 拜登时代结束时的美国学生债务比他上任时还多
item.description: 乔-拜登总统的标志性承诺之一是减轻数百万美国人的学生贷款负担。他离任时，债务总额将比他上任时略有增加。【原文：One of President Joe Biden’s signature promises was to ease the student-loan burden on millions of Americans. He’ll leave office with the debt pile slightly bigger than when he arrived.】

item.title: 英国经济增长乏力可能导致里夫斯的预算出现 300 亿英镑的缺口
item.description: 彭博社的计算显示，如果财政大臣雷切尔-里夫斯（Rachel Reeves）的计划是基于伦敦金融城的最新预测，而不是英国官方的经济增长预测，那么她将面临 300 亿英镑（367 亿美元）的黑洞。【原文：Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves would be left with a £30 billion ($36.7 billion) black hole if her plans were based on up-to-date City forecasts instead of the UK’s official growth projections, Bloomberg calculations show.】
